trans-unit.source: Adding/removing local CNAME records will restart the DNS server.

trans-unit.id: Adding/removing local DNS records will flush the cache but does not require a restart of the DNS server.
trans-unit.source: Adding/removing local DNS records will flush the cache but does not require a restart of the DNS server.

trans-unit.id: Advertise DNS server multiple times to clients. Some devices will add their own proprietary DNS servers to the list of DNS servers, which can cause issues with Pi-hole. This option will advertise the Pi-hole DNS server multiple times to clients, which should prevent this from happening.
trans-unit.source: Advertise DNS server multiple times to clients. Some devices will add their own proprietary DNS servers to the list of DNS servers, which can cause issues with Pi-hole. This option will advertise the Pi-hole DNS server multiple times to clients, which should prevent this from happening.

trans-unit.id: All reverse lookups for private IP ranges (i.e., 192.168.0.x/24, etc.) which are not found in /etc/hosts or the DHCP leases are answered with "no such domain" rather than being forwarded upstream. The set of prefixes affected is the list given in RFC6303.
trans-unit.source: All reverse lookups for private IP ranges (i.e., 192.168.0.x/24, etc.) which are not found in /etc/hosts or the DHCP leases are answered with "no such domain" rather than being forwarded upstream. The set of prefixes affected is the list given in RFC6303.

trans-unit.note: Displayed on the App Tint Settings screen.

trans-unit.id: Clients may be described by their IP, MAC, or hostname.
trans-unit.source: Clients may be described by their IP, MAC, or hostname.

trans-unit.id:
Clients may be described either by their IP addresses (IPv4 and IPv6 are supported), IP subnets (CIDR notation, like 192.168.2.0/24), their MAC addresses (like 12:34:56:78:9A:BC), by their hostnames (like localhost), or by the interface they are connected to (prefaced with a colon, like :eth0).
Note that client recognition by IP addresses (incl. subnet ranges) are preferred over MAC address, host name or interface recognition as the two latter will only be available after some time. Furthermore, MAC address recognition only works for devices at most one networking hop away from your Pi-hole.
trans-unit.source:
Clients may be described either by their IP addresses (IPv4 and IPv6 are supported), IP subnets (CIDR notation, like 192.168.2.0/24), their MAC addresses (like 12:34:56:78:9A:BC), by their hostnames (like localhost), or by the interface they are connected to (prefaced with a colon, like :eth0).
Note that client recognition by IP addresses (incl. subnet ranges) are preferred over MAC address, host name or interface recognition as the two latter will only be available after some time. Furthermore, MAC address recognition only works for devices at most one networking hop away from your Pi-hole.

trans-unit.id: Enable this option to enable IPv6 support for the Pi-hole DHCP server. This will allow the Pi-hole to hand out IPv6 addresses to clients and also provide IPv6 router advertisements (RA) to clients. This option is only useful if the Pi-hole is configured with an IPv6 address.
trans-unit.source: Enable this option to enable IPv6 support for the Pi-hole DHCP server. This will allow the Pi-hole to hand out IPv6 addresses to clients and also provide IPv6 router advertisements (RA) to clients. This option is only useful if the Pi-hole is configured with an IPv6 address.

trans-unit.id:
Hi there, if you're seeing this it means that somehow the button to give you Lifetime PHR+ for free didn't work and you had to contact me. Sorry for that! To get access anyways, please enter the code I gave you here.
Please do not share this code with others.
trans-unit.source:
Hi there, if you're seeing this it means that somehow the button to give you Lifetime PHR+ for free didn't work and you had to contact me. Sorry for that! To get access anyways, please enter the code I gave you here.
Please do not share this code with others.

I see you don't have an active mail client on your device, please mail me with the request to join the TestFlight including a screenshot of this PHR+ screen so I can see you have purchased Pro.

trans-unit.id: If set, the domain is added to simple names (without a period) in /etc/hosts in the same way as for DHCP-derived names.
trans-unit.source: If set, the domain is added to simple names (without a period) in /etc/hosts in the same way as for DHCP-derived names.

trans-unit.id:
If this option is set, Pi-hole ignores all clients which are not explicitly configured through dhcp.hosts. This can be useful to prevent unauthorized clients from getting an IP address from the DHCP server. It should be noted that this option is not a security feature, as clients can still assign themselves an IP address and use the network. It is merely a convenience feature to prevent unknown clients from getting a valid IP configuration assigned automatically.
Note: When this feature is enabled you will need to configure new clients manually in dhcp.hosts before they can use the network.
trans-unit.source:
If this option is set, Pi-hole ignores all clients which are not explicitly configured through dhcp.hosts. This can be useful to prevent unauthorized clients from getting an IP address from the DHCP server. It should be noted that this option is not a security feature, as clients can still assign themselves an IP address and use the network. It is merely a convenience feature to prevent unknown clients from getting a valid IP configuration assigned automatically.
Note: When this feature is enabled you will need to configure new clients manually in dhcp.hosts before they can use the network.

trans-unit.id: Lets give the Lists-tab a massive feature-boost!
trans-unit.source: Lets give the Lists-tab a massive feature-boost!

trans-unit.id:
Lets start 2021 with a huge update!
Many highly requested features in this one. I've considered making some features of this update a paid in-app-purchase because of the significant development time, but decided against it. I would very much appreciate a tip if you use the app often, it would help a lot! If you can't afford to tip for any reason, that's of course totally fine :-) Enjoy the app, tell your friends, maybe leave a review!
I hope you will all enjoy this massive update and I wish you all a Happy New Year! - Joost
trans-unit.source:
Lets start 2021 with a huge update!
Many highly requested features in this one. I've considered making some features of this update a paid in-app-purchase because of the significant development time, but decided against it. I would very much appreciate a tip if you use the app often, it would help a lot! If you can't afford to tip for any reason, that's of course totally fine :-) Enjoy the app, tell your friends, maybe leave a review!
I hope you will all enjoy this massive update and I wish you all a Happy New Year! - Joost

trans-unit.id:
Tells Pi-hole to never forward A or AAAA queries for plain names, without dots or domain parts, to upstream nameservers. If the name is not known from /etc/hosts or DHCP then a "not found" answer is returned.
If Conditional Forwarding is enabled, unticking this box may cause a partial DNS loop under certain circumstances (e.g. if a client would send TLD DNSSEC queries).
trans-unit.source:
Tells Pi-hole to never forward A or AAAA queries for plain names, without dots or domain parts, to upstream nameservers. If the name is not known from /etc/hosts or DHCP then a "not found" answer is returned.
If Conditional Forwarding is enabled, unticking this box may cause a partial DNS loop under certain circumstances (e.g. if a client would send TLD DNSSEC queries).

trans-unit.note: Used on the PHR+ purchase screen.

trans-unit.id: Thank you for downloading the app! ❤️
trans-unit.source: Thank you for downloading the app! ❤️

trans-unit.id:
Thank you so much for downloading/purchasing the app before the large v6 update.
Building v6 was a massive undertaking (I'm still working on bringing back missing features from v5 that didn't make this first release) and with the switch to IAPs I didn't want existing users to have to pay again, therefore you got PHR+ for free.
In return, I would really appreciate it if you could leave a review in the App Store or leave a small donation to support my work 😊 If you can't, that's also okay! Enjoy the app. - Joost
trans-unit.source:
Thank you so much for downloading/purchasing the app before the large v6 update.
Building v6 was a massive undertaking (I'm still working on bringing back missing features from v5 that didn't make this first release) and with the switch to IAPs I didn't want existing users to have to pay again, therefore you got PHR+ for free.
In return, I would really appreciate it if you could leave a review in the App Store or leave a small donation to support my work 😊 If you can't, that's also okay! Enjoy the app. - Joost

trans-unit.note: Used in the Settings-tab, displayed when someone has PHR+ active.

trans-unit.id: The DHCPv4 rapid commit option allows the Pi-hole DHCP server to assign an IP address to a client right away. This can notably speed up the address assignment process and you will notice, e.g., faster WiFi joins in your network. This option should only be enabled if the Pi-hole DHCP server is the only DHCP server in your network.
trans-unit.source: The DHCPv4 rapid commit option allows the Pi-hole DHCP server to assign an IP address to a client right away. This can notably speed up the address assignment process and you will notice, e.g., faster WiFi joins in your network. This option should only be enabled if the Pi-hole DHCP server is the only DHCP server in your network.

trans-unit.id: The DNS domains for your Pi-hole. If no domain is specified and you are using Pi-hole's DHCP server, then any hostnames with a domain part (i.e., with a period) will be disallowed. If a domain is specified, then hostnames with a domain parts matching the domain here are allowed. In addition, when a suffix is set then hostnames without a domain part have the suffix added as an optional domain part.
trans-unit.source: The DNS domains for your Pi-hole. If no domain is specified and you are using Pi-hole's DHCP server, then any hostnames with a domain part (i.e., with a period) will be disallowed. If a domain is specified, then hostnames with a domain parts matching the domain here are allowed. In addition, when a suffix is set then hostnames without a domain part have the suffix added as an optional domain part.

trans-unit.id: The comment will be added to all entries.
trans-unit.source: The comment will be added to all entries.

trans-unit.id: The expected format is `IP#port`, where the `port` is optional (defaults to 53).
trans-unit.source: The expected format is `IP#port`, where the `port` is optional (defaults to 53).

trans-unit.id: The lease time can be in seconds, minutes (e.g., "45m"), hours (e.g., "1h"), days (like "2d"), or even weeks ("1w"). If no lease time is specified (empty), dnsmasq's default lease time is one hour for IPv4 and one day for IPv6. You may also use "infinite" as string but be aware of the drawbacks: assigned addresses are will only be made available again after the lease time has passed or when leases are manually deleted below.
trans-unit.source: The lease time can be in seconds, minutes (e.g., "45m"), hours (e.g., "1h"), days (like "2d"), or even weeks ("1w"). If no lease time is specified (empty), dnsmasq's default lease time is one hour for IPv4 and one day for IPv6. You may also use "infinite" as string but be aware of the drawbacks: assigned addresses are will only be made available again after the lease time has passed or when leases are manually deleted below.

trans-unit.id: The original enddate when blocking would be enabled again.
trans-unit.source: The original enddate when blocking would be enabled again.

trans-unit.id: The red options are dangerous on devices directly connected to the Internet such as cloud instances and are only safe if your Pi-hole is properly firewalled.
trans-unit.source: The red options are dangerous on devices directly connected to the Internet such as cloud instances and are only safe if your Pi-hole is properly firewalled.

trans-unit.id: The red options are dangerous on devices directly connected to the Internet such as cloud instances and are only safe if your Pi-hole is properly firewalled. In a typical at-home setup where your Pi-hole is located within your local network (and you have not forwarded port 53 in your router!) they are safe to use.
trans-unit.source: The red options are dangerous on devices directly connected to the Internet such as cloud instances and are only safe if your Pi-hole is properly firewalled. In a typical at-home setup where your Pi-hole is located within your local network (and you have not forwarded port 53 in your router!) they are safe to use.

trans-unit.id: This device is probably not using Pi-hole, because no queries were found.
trans-unit.source: This device is probably not using Pi-hole, because no queries were found.

trans-unit.id: This is the last version that supports iOS 13 and macOS 10.15.
trans-unit.source: This is the last version that supports iOS 13 and macOS 10.15.

trans-unit.id: This version requires iOS 16.2+ / watchOS 10.0+ and **Pi-hole v6.0** or higher, because it uses the new Pi-hole API with much improved capabilities.
trans-unit.source: This version requires iOS 16.2+ / watchOS 10.0+ and **Pi-hole v6.0** or higher, because it uses the new Pi-hole API with much improved capabilities.

trans-unit.source: Toggle blocking status for one or all instances.

trans-unit.source: Toggle only between enabled & disabled. Hold the button for more options.

trans-unit.id: Use NextDNS? Have I got an app for you.
trans-unit.source: Use NextDNS? Have I got an app for you.

trans-unit.id: Users who purchased the app while it was paid upfront instead of free with in-app purchases, can get PHR+ Lifetime for free as a thank you. Please press the button below to let the app check if you're entitled to it. This will show a native iOS alert to restore the purchase.
trans-unit.source: Users who purchased the app while it was paid upfront instead of free with in-app purchases, can get PHR+ Lifetime for free as a thank you. Please press the button below to let the app check if you're entitled to it. This will show a native iOS alert to restore the purchase.

trans-unit.id: Validate DNS replies and cache DNSSEC data. When forwarding DNS queries, Pi-hole requests the DNSSEC records needed to validate the replies. If a domain fails validation or the upstream does not support DNSSEC, this setting can cause issues resolving domains. Use an upstream DNS server which supports DNSSEC when activating DNSSEC. Note that the size of your log might increase significantly when enabling DNSSEC.
trans-unit.source: Validate DNS replies and cache DNSSEC data. When forwarding DNS queries, Pi-hole requests the DNSSEC records needed to validate the replies. If a domain fails validation or the upstream does not support DNSSEC, this setting can cause issues resolving domains. Use an upstream DNS server which supports DNSSEC when activating DNSSEC. Note that the size of your log might increase significantly when enabling DNSSEC.

trans-unit.note: Displayed on the support screen on the 'Force Watch Sync' button.

trans-unit.id:
When a client makes too many queries in too short time, it gets rate-limited. Rate-limited queries are answered with a REFUSED reply and not further processed by FTL and prevent Pi-holes getting overwhelmed by rogue clients. It is important to note that rate-limiting is happening on a per-client basis. Other clients can continue to use FTL while rate-limited clients are short-circuited at the same time.
Rate-limiting may be disabled altogether by setting both values to zero.
trans-unit.source:
When a client makes too many queries in too short time, it gets rate-limited. Rate-limited queries are answered with a REFUSED reply and not further processed by FTL and prevent Pi-holes getting overwhelmed by rogue clients. It is important to note that rate-limiting is happening on a per-client basis. Other clients can continue to use FTL while rate-limited clients are short-circuited at the same time.
Rate-limiting may be disabled altogether by setting both values to zero.

trans-unit.id:
When you use HTTPS you must make sure to install the certificate to your device first. If you don't do this, the app might not be able to establish a secure connection to your Pi-hole.
The default location of your certificate is on your device: /etc/pihole/tls.pem. Mail the file to yourself and open it on your device to install it.
trans-unit.source:
When you use HTTPS you must make sure to install the certificate to your device first. If you don't do this, the app might not be able to establish a secure connection to your Pi-hole.
The default location of your certificate is on your device: /etc/pihole/tls.pem. Mail the file to yourself and open it on your device to install it.

trans-unit.id: You can configure an application password in the Pi-hole Web Interface. Be aware that you can have only *one* applciation password at a time.
trans-unit.source: You can configure an application password in the Pi-hole Web Interface. Be aware that you can have only *one* applciation password at a time.

trans-unit.id: You've reached the maximum of 6 presets.
trans-unit.source: You've reached the maximum of 6 presets.

trans-unit.id: Your password and TOTP token will be used only once to create an 'application password' and are deleted afterwards.
trans-unit.source: Your password and TOTP token will be used only once to create an 'application password' and are deleted afterwards.
Disable Pi-hole blocking on one or all of your instances for a specific duration.
trans-unit.target: Schakel blokkeren uit voor een of meerdere instanties, voor een bepaalde tijd.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the duration to disable for, in minutes. Set to '0' to disable indefinitely.
trans-unit.target: Voor hoe lang blokkeren uitgeschakeld moet worden, in minuten. Zet op '0' om uit te schakelen tot je blokkeren weer aanzet.

trans-unit.source: Enable Pi-hole blocking on one or all of your instances.
trans-unit.target: Schakel blokkeren in voor een of meerdere instanties.

trans-unit.source: Swipe to the right to add a service to your favorites.
trans-unit.target: Swipe naar rechts om een dienst toe te voegen aan je favorieten.

trans-unit.source: The Changelog will only be shown for feature-updates, not for updates that only contain bugfixes.
trans-unit.target: De changelog zal alleen getoond worden na een update met nieuwe features, niet voor updates met alleen bugfixes.

trans-unit.note: Placeholder for the hostname textfield on the instance settings screen.

trans-unit.source: Rather use AdGuard DNS? I've got you covered.
trans-unit.target: Gebruik je AdGuard DNS? Daar is ook een app voor.

trans-unit.source: It's like Pi-hole Remote, but for AdGuard Home!
trans-unit.target: Net als Pi-hole Remote, maar voor AdGuard Home!

trans-unit.source: Monitor real-time electricity and gas prices in many European countries.
trans-unit.target: Real-time inzicht in stroom- en gasprijzen in Nederland en andere Europese landen.

trans-unit.source:
In June 2020 I started building my own apps as an independent developer, under the name 'RocketScience IT'.
My main goal is to learn: design, development, testing, support, promotion - maybe even more! Right now, I have several apps in the store which I'm continuously improving & have many ideas for other apps I might want to make in the future.
trans-unit.target:
In juni 2020 ben ik begonnen met het maken van m'n eigen apps als indie ontwikkelaar, onder de naam 'RocketScience IT'.
Mijn doel is om te leren: ontwerpen, ontwikkelen, testen, support, marketing - misschien nog wel meer! Op dit moment heb ik een aantal apps in de App Store die ik continue verbeter. Daarnaast heb ik nog veel ideeën voor andere apps die ik wil maken in de toekomst!

trans-unit.source: A clean Anime & Manga tracker app, using the MyAnimeList API.
trans-unit.target: Een Anime & Manga tracking app die gebruik maakt van de MyAnimeList API.

trans-unit.source: The Tip Jar helps keep Pi-hole Remote running and directly supports development of awesome features and improvements.
trans-unit.target: De Tip Jar helpt me direct om Pi-hole Remote te blijven onderhouden en nieuwe features te ontwikkelen.

trans-unit.source: If you enjoy using this app and want to support a one-man-team indie developer (hi! 👋), please consider leaving a tip. I would greatly appreciate it!
trans-unit.target: Als je de app tof vindt en deze indie developer (hoi! 👋) wil steunen, kan je een donatie geven. Ik waardeer het enorm!

trans-unit.source: Thank you for your support. - Joost

Note: you're running a TestFlight Build, therefore payments run in Sandbox mode and do not actually process.
If you want to tip, please download the app from the App Store! After that you can download the beta again. Thanks!
trans-unit.target:
Note: you're running a TestFlight Build, therefore payments run in Sandbox mode and do not actually process.
If you want to tip, please download the app from the App Store! After that you can download the beta again. Thanks!

trans-unit.source:
Thank you so much, I really appreciate the fact that you love the app so much you're willing to give a tip. It's extremely motivating as well. I love you!
Joost
trans-unit.target:
Super erg bedankt, ik waardeer het echt enorm dat je de app zo goed vindt dat je er zelfs nog een donatie voor wil geven. Super motiverend, bedankt!
Joost

trans-unit.source: Thank you for your generous tip!
Thank you for your generous tips!
Please add a Pi-hole instance in the iPhone app.
trans-unit.target: Voeg een Pi-hole instantie toe in de iPhone app.

trans-unit.source: If you already did, please go to your instance, press 'Edit' and press 'Save' again. It should show up after that. If the statistics don't load at first, please restart the Watch app. Thanks!
trans-unit.target: Als je dat al gedaan hebt, ga dan op je iPhone naar Instellingen, tik op 'Bewerken', en tik opnieuw op 'Opslaan'. Daarna moet je de instantie kunnen zien in de Watch app. Als de statistieken niet laden, restart dan de Watch app. Bedankt!

trans-unit.source: Check in on your queries over time.
Keep an eye on one statistic.
trans-unit.target: Houd een statistiek in de gaten.

trans-unit.source: Keep an eye on all your statistics.

trans-unit.id: • Client & Group Management • Change DHCP & DNS Settings • Interactive Widgets • Multiple Instances • And much more!
trans-unit.source: • Client & Group Management • Change DHCP & DNS Settings • Interactive Widgets • Multiple Instances • And much more!
